pr_title: Fixed NPEs related to dynamic configuration

timeline.bodyText:
Why do we need to move the get on the Kafka cluster description?
Maybe add a comment for the context why this breaks convention.
timeline.author: samuel-hawker
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -265,6 +265,7 @@ public KafkaAssemblyOperator(Vertx vertx, PlatformFeaturesAvailability pfa,
         reconcileState.initialStatus()
                 .compose(state -> state.reconcileCas(this::dateSupplier))
                 .compose(state -> state.clusterOperatorSecret(this::dateSupplier))
+                .compose(state -> state.getKafkaClusterDescription())

replies.bodyText: getKafkaClusterDescription() defines kafkaCluster what is used in rollingUpdateForNewCaKey() for KafkaRoller ctor.
replies.author: sknot-rh

replies.bodyText: Makes sense, can we add that as a comment to make that intent clear in the reconcile?
replies.author: samuel-hawker

replies.bodyText: I wonder how much dangerous this is since creating the description too early can break other things.
replies.author: scholzj

replies.bodyText:
To be honest, this move kind of smells of improper separation of responsibilities.
Is there a less heavy handed way of supplying the information needed in rollingUpdateForNewCaKey?
replies.author: samuel-hawker

replies.bodyText:
I had a look at the code and I do not think moving the method would cause any issues (should be confirmed by STs as well).
I agree that this shows deeper issues. I think the problem is that we do Kafka rolling upgrade on multiple places (C renewals, upgrades, regular RUetc.) and not just in one place. That leads to inconsistencies and errors. But I think it is beyond this PR to fix that. We should probably have some issue for it and look at it in the future.
replies.author: scholzj

timeline.bodyText:
It might be worth documenting a null desired state does not mean an empty broker state but is indeed a shortcut for saying no changes required.
This can not be assumed and should be in the javadoc
timeline.author: samuel-hawker
